channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: Do you take a photo of something hoping to remember it later? How has that worked out for you? Terribly for me.

There’ve been a few recent tweets that I can’t stop thinking about.
I can’t stop thinking about this tweet. https://t.co/EJcrpKLJq2
I can’t stop thinking about this tweet. https://t.co/54E47ZCklj
I can’t stop thinking about this tweet. https://t.co/klDoV7l4u9
The @alltartans account has been really good lately. Even better than usual.

Council should’ve voted for the guy who said he would be a good steward and wanted to gain the experience of being a councillor. https://t.co/X5rushGMAu
I like the cut of this guy’s jib. https://t.co/3OgWk3Bi13
*Owen Wilson Wow* https://t.co/NZHQ4Q00GH

Halfway through the year, and I’m well on my way to listening to more music than I did in 2007. Buying good wireless headphones in April had a lot to do with that. https://t.co/tS1ghc2aWw
For a while I was listening to albums… https://t.co/R8JCwVCfEi
…and then I started to listen to an artist’s entire discography, in chronological order if possible (sometimes all of their albums aren’t online, or I can’t wait to listen to a certain album)…
…and now I’m more and more listening to playlists, usually shuffled.
I’m really digging this playlist. https://t.co/HPyLsA2jPM
The thought of owning a cowboy shirt again occurred to me other day, and I haven’t been able to shake it since.
I don’t know what I’m doing tonight.

Can I get more certainty on when the 7th wave will hit? I’d like to know when to not tell my crushes I’m in love with them. True, it’s never, but I’d still like that phase of the pandemic in my calendar. https://t.co/9DI7ydTdGS
@beanjammin Probably, yes.
That makes two people who will not run for the leadership of the UCP. Who else will join us in not running? https://t.co/TEpkgY7gSr
@ChristianPeel @alexkli @gruber https://t.co/gmqESBYXtw
@TimeOutTravel Jupiter: “For now.”
@GDNAToronto @CycleToronto The City of Toronto updated their website on the Rich-Adel Corridor, or, as us locals call It, the RAC. https://t.co/IAe1xXS0qa
@syncros If you find out that it is, can I interview you for the entry about it in my forthcoming book, Toronto: The Good Parts?

A reminder for audience members asking questions of a speaker: “I don’t need a mic” might be something you truly believe, but you don’t know who needs you to use a mic so that they can hear you.
If the session is being recorded and you didn’t say your more-of-a-comment-than-a-question into a microphone, it probably didn’t get captured.
Tonight. https://t.co/9r7ksWaH81
@CatherineOmega The food’s not too bad, either.

The Chinese Food food truck survived the pandemic. I was worried about that. https://t.co/5uRbUhxszM
See? There’s more than one. Amazing. https://t.co/MxoX8z1qWK
Minor realization: I’m more worried that something that hasn’t happened to me in 17 years will happen than I am hopeful, because it came as a surprise then, and I hate surprises.
@adamrg Also, “You’re my only hope.” I thought for sure a certain character at the start of the show, talking to Obi-Wan via holomessage, would say that.

@GraphicMatt I’m not saying this will happen (I’m really not), but I’ve heard of cases where organizers cancelled events only to ultimately put them on because they were worried too many people would attend. Again, not saying that what’s going on here, it was just something that came to mind.
@adamrg Also, “You’re my only hope.” I though for sure a certain character at the start of the show, talking to Obi-Wan via holomessage, would say that.
@Stv When I worked at Zellers as a teenager, yup, I sure did.
Notes will be abused somehow, in a way Twitter didn’t anticipate. https://t.co/VHzziYfyWr

The memeification of a serious topic makes positive change impossible. https://t.co/hhGdklrCWt
See what I mean? Smart, walkable urbanism is impossible now. https://t.co/CGmEL57oRY
